ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Broader knowledge about modern treatment of solids from a theoretical perspective.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
I enjoyed going through a lot of the topics and I think I definitely was exposed to a lot of new things.

I would have preferred if the class was structured to have less overlap with Many-Body Theory.  I understand that some topics needed to be covered again at some level for completeness, but I think we could have covered a lot more if we had left out parts of ARPES and Fermi Liquid Theory in favor of more coverage on topological materials or some other topic.  This might also help the time constraints given our propensity to go over time each lecture.  To me, it makes more sense that dedicated students would eventually take both classes, so if this was to be offered more frequently, I think that would be a more apt structure.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I think Leonid was great, and I think it was a great introduction to lots of topics in condensed matter physics that you always hear about by name but perhaps didn't study in great detail.
